item.title: IL-23 Inhibition Across Psoriatic Disease* and Inflammatory Bowel Disease†
item.body: Watch Dr. Khattri & Jennifer Labas, MSN, discuss IL-23 inhibition in adults with active PsA, moderate to severe plaque PsO, moderately to severely active UC, & moderately to severely active CD

item.title: Underserved and Under-treated
item.body: Watch our Underserved and Under-Treated series as part of this month's Mission: APP Partners in Care campaign. Now available: Vaccine Pearls & Health Maintenance in the Rheum Clinic, Lifestyle Medicine and Pain Management.

item.title: Sjögren’s Disease – What Are You Missing?
item.body: What could you be missing in Sjögren's disease? Explore hypothetical patient cases with atypical presentations, systemic manifestations, and overlooked symptoms. Gain expert insights and practical tips for clinical assessment from Dr Shereen Mahmood and learn how the ESSDAI can help you measure disease activity.

item.title: A JAKi in GCA: Phase 3 Results Through 2 Years
item.body: Listen as rheumatologists Dr. Anisha Dua and Dr. Ben Boone discuss the latest efficacy and safety results over 2 years from a Phase 3 trial in GCA, including remission, flares, and glucocorticoid use in patients continuing vs withdrawing a JAKi"
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by AbbVie Medical Affairs + Health Impact

item.title: A JAKi CHAT: Shared Decision-Making in RA
item.body: Experts Dr. Jeffrey Curtis and Dr. Kevin Winthrop discuss best practices for shared decision-making, how to talk with patients about the risks of poorly controlled RA, and ways to use a new tool for visualizing the long-term safety of a JAKi.
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by AbbVie Medical Affairs + Health Impact

item.title: ILD Treatment and Guidelines
item.body: Watch our 11-video series on ILD Treatment and Guidelines including videos on assessing ILD, guidelines caveats and concerns, and more.

item.title: Structural damage progression in active PsA
item.body: Watch Dr. Philip Mease discuss the impact of structural damage on active PsA and follow along as he reviews clinical trial data

item.title: Navigating the Path to SLE Remission
item.body: Watch rheumatologists Dr Anca Askanase and Dr Cristina Arriens discuss their clinical perspectives on how to target and achieve DORIS remission in clinical practice.

item.title: GCA: Case by Case
item.body: Dive into 4 hypothetical case studies that reveal the diverse and often complex presentations of giant cell arteritis (GCA). Each case is guided by expert commentary from Dr Michael Putman, where he offers practical insights and clinical pearls to enhance your therapeutic strategies for this multifaceted condition.
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by Novartis US Medical Affairs

item.title: Debunked. Expert perspectives on Sjögren’s Disease myths
item.body: How well do you know Sjögren’s disease? Test your knowledge and then hear rheumatologist, Dr Sara McCoy, discuss common myths and realities about managing patients with Sjögren’s disease.

item.title: Patient Phenotypes Within the Clinical Program of an IL-23 Inhibitor for PsA
item.body: Watch rheumatologist Dr. Alexis Ogdie and rheumatologist and dermatologist Dr. Saakshi Khattri discuss a new analysis of patient phenotypes in PsA from clinical trials of an IL-23 inhibitor. In this conversation, they discuss disease activity differences between clinical trial populations and real-world patients, efficacy of an IL-23 inhibitor in a bionaïve, moderate PsA phenotype, and the IL-23 inhibitor's potential role in managing patients with PsA.
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by AbbVie Medical Affairs + Health Impact

item.title: A Phase 3 Trial of a JAKi in Patients With Giant Cell Arteritis
item.body: Listen as coinvestigator and rheumatologist Dr. Andrea Rubbert-Roth reviews this Phase 3 trial of a JAKi in patients with giant cell arteritis. Dr. Rubbert-Roth discusses the latest results, including efficacy and safety outcomes.
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by AbbVie Medical Affairs + Health Impact

item.title: Lupus Nephritis
item.body: View our six video perspectives on lupus nephritis, including Management of CKD in Lupus Nephritis.

item.title: Biomarkers in RA
item.body: Rheumatologist Dr. Walter Maksymowych discusses the role of biomarkers in RA care, with a focus on 14-3-3eta as a modifiable marker for diagnosis and monitoring disease progression.

item.title: Treatment goals for RA: Is it time to transition MOAs?
item.body: Rheumatologists Dr. Christina Charles-Schoeman and Dr. Manish Jain discuss their approaches to setting and pursuing treatment goals for patients with poorly controlled RA after TNFis
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by AbbVie Medical Affairs + Health Impact

item.title: EXXELERATE: New Thoughts on High RF Titer
item.body: Two leading rheumatologists share insights into why RF levels are important to consider when identifying treatment options for patients with RA.

item.title: Autoimmune Myositis: The Role of the Laboratory in Diagnosis and Phenotyping
item.body: Hear from rheumatologist Stanley J. Naides MD, FACP, FACR, as he details the clinical features of autoimmune myositis, the associated phenotypes and autoantibodies, plus the methodologies and testing options to support a myositis diagnosis.

item.title: Minimizing Steroids in Lupus
item.body: Minimizing steroid use in patients with SLE. Learn more about when, why, and how to taper steroids and listen to experts, Dr Michelle Petri and Dr Leanna Wise, discuss key data and their clinical perspectives on these topics.

item.title: RA Risk Radar: Heart Disease, Infection, and Malignancy
item.body: Listen as rheumatologists Dr. Jeffery Curtis and Dr. Jon Giles review comorbidities that can occur as a consequence of uncontrolled, or under-controlled, inflammation in rheumatoid arthritis. In this conversation they share their clinical expertise on a range of topics, including risk assessment, risk management, and the importance of disease control.

item.title: Physician Case Reports: Manifestations in Patients with Severe Active GPA/MPA
item.body: A review of two physician case reports. These cases are patients who presented with severe active manifestations of granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA) or microscopic polyangiitis (MPA).

item.title: Earlier treatment with biologics to reduce the risk of organ damage in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)
item.body: Learn about the importance of reducing organ damage and corticosteroid-associated toxicity in SLE, and how biologics may help to change the course of the disease by targeting its underlying mechanisms.
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by GSK US Medical Affairs

item.title: Diagnosis of PMR
item.body: Nine perspectives now available: Red Flags in the Diagnosis of PMR; Epidemiology of PMR; Role of the PCP in Diagnosis and Care; Importance of Diagnostic Imaging; ESR/CRP in PMR; PMR Must Rule Outs; Which PMR Patients Should Rheumatologists See?; Is There Hidden GCA?; and PMR Mimics.

item.title: Hard Decisions in RA
item.body: Eight debates and perspectives on Hard Decisions in RA now available.

item.title: Women in Rheumatology: Gender Issues in Disease and Management
item.body: Nine videos discussing gender differences in axSpA, PsA, Vasculitis, Lung Disease, Osteoporosis, Disparities in Healthcare, and Rheumatologic Activity and Treatment, are now available.

item.title: Solving Still's Disease
item.body: Dr. Jack Cush reviews the history, manifestations, diagnosis and treatment of Still's disease.
item.field_author_attribution: RheumNow

item.title: The Future of PsA
item.body: As we conclude our PsA campaign, Dr. Ogdie shares information about Preventing PsA and Dr. Ritchlin discusses Future Discovery and Targets.
item.field_author_attribution: RheumNow

item.title: Women Leaders in Rheumatology: Leadership in a Virtual World
item.body: A moderated panel of prominent female rheumatologists will discuss the challenges and successes in clinical practice and research that they encountered during the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.field_author_attribution: Sponsored by Bristol Myers Squibb and the Bristol Myers Squibb Network of Women (B-NOW)

item.title: COVID-19 Patient PSA Video Series
item.body: Dr. Jack Cush provides a series of "Patient Safety Advisories" on how patients can cope with the COVID-19 pandemic and rheumatology-related illnesses.
item.field_author_attribution: RheumNow

item.title: Biosimilars in Rheumatology
item.body: A first-of-its kind educational video series focusing on the “hot topics” in biosimilars from the perspective of leading Rheumatology experts. This educational series is presented by Sandoz, Inc.
item.field_author_attribution: RheumNow

item.title: Best of EULAR 2018
item.body: A video matrix of the best moments and findings from our coverage of EULAR 2018 in Amsterdam
item.field_author_attribution: RheumNow
